remarks: The inverse isomorphism H of the span of a singleton is a Hilbert lattice atom.  (Contributed by NM, 27-Apr-2014.)
statement:
dihlspsnat.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
dihlspsnat.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
dihlspsnat.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dihlspsnat.v $e |- V = ( Base ` U ) $.
dihlspsnat.o $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` U ) $.
dihlspsnat.n $e |- N = ( LSpan ` U ) $.
dihlspsnat.i $e |- I = ( ( DIsoH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dihlspsnat $p |- ( ( ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) /\ X e. V /\ X =/= .0. ) -> ( `' I ` ( N ` { X } ) ) e. A ) $.
